fix-message.name: Heartbeat
fix-message.description: The Heartbeat monitors the status of the communication link and identifies when the last of a string of messages was not received.

fix-message.name: Test Request
fix-message.description: The test request message forces a heartbeat from the opposing application.

fix-message.name: Resend Request
fix-message.description: The resend request is sent by the receiving application to initiate the retransmission of messages.

fix-message.name: Reject
fix-message.description: The reject message should be issued when a message is received but cannot be properly processed due to a session-level rule violation. A

fix-message.name: Sequence Reset
fix-message.description: The sequence reset message is used by the sending application to reset the incoming sequence number on the opposing side.

fix-message.name: Logout
fix-message.description: Normal termination of the message exchange session will be completed via the exchange of Logout messages.

fix-message.name: Indication
fix-message.description: Indication of interest messages market merchandise which the broker is buying or selling in either a proprietary or agency capacity.

fix-message.name: Advertisement
fix-message.description: Advertisement messages are used to announce completed transactions.

fix-message.name: Execution
fix-message.description:
The execution report message is used to:
1. confirm the receipt of an order
2. confirm changes to an existing order (i.e. accept cancel and replace requests)
3. relay order status information
4. relay fill information on working orders
5. reject orders
6. report post-trade fees calculations associated with a trade
NOTE: Execution reports do not replace the end-of-day confirm. Execution reports are to be regarded only as replacements for the existing fill messages currently communicated via telephone.

fix-message.name: Order Cancel Reject
fix-message.description: The order cancel reject message is issued by the broker upon receipt of a cancel request or cancel/replace request message which cannot be honored.

fix-message.name: Logon
fix-message.description: Establishing a FIX connection involves three distinct operations: creation of a telecommunications level link, authentication/acceptance of the initiator by the acceptor and message synchronization (initialization).

fix-message.name: News
fix-message.description: The news message is a general free format message between the broker and institution.

fix-message.name: Email
fix-message.description: The email message is similar to the format and purpose of to the News message, however, it is intended for private use between two par.

fix-message.name: Order
fix-message.description: The new order message type is used by institutions wishing to electronically submit securities and forex orders to a broker for execution.

fix-message.name: List Order
fix-message.description: The NewOrderList Message can be used in one of two ways depending on which market conventions are being followed.

fix-message.name: Order Cancel Request
fix-message.description: The order cancel request message requests the cancelation of all of the remaining quantity of an existing order. Note that the Order Cancel/Replace Request should be used to partially cancel (reduce) an order).

fix-message.name: Order Replace Request
fix-message.description: The order cancel/replace request is used to change the parameters of an existing order.

fix-message.name: Order Status Request
fix-message.description: The order status request message is used by the institution to generate an order status message back from the broker.

fix-message.name: Allocation
fix-message.description: The Allocation message provides the ability to specify how an order or set of orders should be subdivided amongst one or more accounts. It can also be used as a confirmation message through which third parties can communicate execution and settlement details between trading partners. In addition, the allocation message can be sent by the broker to communicate fees and other details that can only be computed once the sub-account breakdowns are known.

fix-message.name: List Cancel Request
fix-message.description: The list cancel request message type is used by institutions wishing to cancel previously submitted lists either before or during execution.

fix-message.name: List Execute
fix-message.description: he list execute message type is used by institutions to instruct the broker to begin execution of a previously submitted list. This message may or may not be used, as it may be mirroring a phone conversation.

fix-message.name: List Status Request
fix-message.description: The list status request message type is used by institutions to instruct the broker to generate status messages for a list.

fix-message.name: List Status
fix-message.description: The list status message is issued as the response to a List Status Request message sent in an unsolicited fashion by the sell-side. It indicates the current state of the orders within the list as they exists at the broker's site.

fix-message.name: Allocation ACK
fix-message.description: The allocation ACK message is used to acknowledge the receipt and status of an allocation message received from the institution.

fix-message.name: DK Trade
fix-message.description: The Don"t Know Trade (DK) message notifies a trading partner that an electronically received execution has been rejected. This message can be thought of as an execution reject message.

fix-message.name: Quote Request
fix-message.description: In some markets it is the practice to request quotes from brokers prior to placement of an order. The quote request message is used for this purpose.

fix-message.name: Quote
fix-message.description: The quote message is used as the response to a Quote Request message and can be used to publish unsolicited quotes.

fix-tag.name: Account
fix-tag.description: Account mnemonic as agreed between broker and institution.

fix-tag.name: AdvID
fix-tag.description: Unique identifier of advertisement message.

fix-tag.name: AdvRefID
fix-tag.description: Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE transaction types.

fix-tag.name: AdvSide
fix-tag.description: Broker's side of advertised trade

fix-tag.name: AdvTransType
fix-tag.description: Identifies advertisement message transaction type

fix-tag.name: AvgPx
fix-tag.description: Calculated average price of all fills on this order.

fix-tag.name: BeginSeqNo
fix-tag.description: Message sequence number of first record in range to be resent

fix-tag.name: BeginString
fix-tag.description:
Identifies beginning of new message and protocol version.

ALWAYS FIRST FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted).

fix-tag.name: BodyLength
fix-tag.description:
Message length, in bytes, forward to the CheckSum field.

ALWAYS SECOND FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted).

< /html>

fix-tag.name: CheckSum
fix-tag.description: Three byte, simple checksum. ALWAYS LAST FIELD IN MESSAGE;

fix-tag.name: ClOrdID
fix-tag.description:
Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution.

Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day.

Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should

consider embedding a date within the ClOrdID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fix-tag.name: Commission
fix-tag.description: Commission. Note if CommType is percentage, Commission of 5% should be represented as .05.

fix-tag.name: CommType
fix-tag.description: Commission type

fix-tag.name: CumQty
fix-tag.description: Total number of shares filled.

fix-tag.name: Currency
fix-tag.description:
Identifies currency used for price.

Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US Dollars.

fix-tag.name: EndSeqNo
fix-tag.description:
Message sequence number of last record in range to be resent.

If request is for a single record BeginSeqNo = EndSeqNo.

If request is for all messages subsequent to a particular message, EndSeqNo = "999999"

fix-tag.name: ExecID
fix-tag.description:
Unique identifier of execution message as assigned by broker

(will be 0 (zero) for ExecTransType=3 (Status)).

Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day or

the life of a multi-day order. Firms which accept multi-day

orders should consider embedding a date within the ExecID

field to assure uniqueness across days.

fix-tag.name: ExecInst
fix-tag.description:
Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor.

If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field

can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

valid-value.name: Percent of volume
valid-value.description: Indicates that the sender does not want to be all of the volume on the floor vs. a specific percentage.

valid-value.name: Primary peg
valid-value.description: Primary market - buy at bid/sell at offer

valid-value.name: Fix Local
valid-value.description: Fixed Peg to Local best bid or offer at time of order

fix-tag.name: ExecRefID
fix-tag.description: Reference identifier used with Cancel and Correct transaction types.

fix-tag.name: ExecTransType
fix-tag.description: Identifies transaction type

fix-tag.name: HandlInst
fix-tag.description: Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

valid-value.name: Automated Private Order
valid-value.description: Automated execution order, private, no Broker intervention

valid-value.name: Auomated Public Order
valid-value.description: Automated execution order, public, Broker intervention OK

fix-tag.name: IDSource
fix-tag.description: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

valid-value.name: Consolidated Tape
valid-value.description: Consolidated Tape Association (CTA) Symbol (SIAC CTS/CQS line format)

fix-tag.name: IOIid
fix-tag.description: Unique identifier of IOI message.

fix-tag.name: IOIOthSvc
fix-tag.description: Indicates if, and on which other services, the indication has been advertised. Each character represents an additonal service.

fix-tag.name: IOIQltyInd
fix-tag.description: Relative quality of indication

fix-tag.name: IOIRefID
fix-tag.description: Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE, transaction types.

fix-tag.name: IOIShares
fix-tag.description: Number of shares in numeric or relative size.

fix-tag.name: IOITransType
fix-tag.description: Identifies IOI message transaction type

fix-tag.name: LastCapacity
fix-tag.description: Broker capacity in order execution

fix-tag.name: LastMkt
fix-tag.description: Market of execution for last fill. See Appendix C of FIX protocol for valid values.

fix-tag.name: LastPx
fix-tag.description: Price of this (last) fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fix-tag.name: LastShares
fix-tag.description: Quantity of shares bought/sold on this (last) fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fix-tag.name: LinesOfText
fix-tag.description: Identifies number of lines of text body

fix-tag.name: MsgSeqNum
fix-tag.description: Integer message sequence number.

fix-tag.name: MsgType
fix-tag.description:
Defines message type. ALWAYS THIRD FIELD IN MESSAGE.(Always unencrypted).

Note: A "U" as the first character in the MsgType field (i.e. U1,

U2, etc) indicates that the message format is privately defined

between the sender and receiver.

valid-value.name: Heartbeat
valid-value.description: The Heartbeat monitors the status of the communication link.

valid-value.name: Test Request
valid-value.description: The test request message forces a heartbeat from the opposing application.

valid-value.name: Resend Request
valid-value.description: The resend request is sent by the receiving application to initiate the retransmission of messages.

fix-tag.name: NewSeqNum
fix-tag.description: New sequence number

fix-tag.name: OrderID
fix-tag.description:
Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness

must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which

accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date

within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fix-tag.name: OrderQty
fix-tag.description: Number of shares ordered.

fix-tag.name: OrdStatus
fix-tag.description: Identifies current status of order.

fix-tag.name: OrdType
fix-tag.description: Order type.

valid-value.name: Funari
valid-value.description: (Limit Day Order with unexecuted portion handled as Market On Close. e.g. Japan).

valid-value.name: Pegged
valid-value.description: requires ExecInst = L, R, M, P or O)

fix-tag.name: OrigClOrdID
fix-tag.description:
ClOrdID of the previous order (NOT the initial order of the day)

as assigned by the institution, used to identify the

previous order in cancel and cancel/replace requests.

fix-tag.name: OrigTime
fix-tag.description: Time of message origination. Aalways expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT").

fix-tag.name: PossDupFlag
fix-tag.description: Indicates possible retransmission of message with this sequence number

fix-tag.name: Price
fix-tag.description: Price per share

fix-tag.name: RefSeqNo
fix-tag.description: Reference message sequence number

fix-tag.name: RelatdSym
fix-tag.description:
Symbol of issue related to story.

Can be repeated within message to identify multiple companies.

fix-tag.name: Rule80A
fix-tag.description: <html>Indicates order type upon which exchange Rule 80A is applied. </html>

valid-value.name: Program Order, index arb, for Member firm/org
Program Order, non-index arb, for Member firm/org
Program Order, index arb, for individual customer
Program Order, non-index arb, for individual customer
Program Order, index arb, for other agency
Program Order, non-index arb, for other agency
Program Order, index arb, for other member
Program Order, non-index arb, for other member
All other orders as agent for other member

fix-tag.name: SecurityID
fix-tag.description: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fix-tag.name: SenderCompID
fix-tag.description: Assigned value used to identify firm sending message.

fix-tag.name: SenderSubID
fix-tag.description: Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (desk, trader, etc.)

fix-tag.name: SendingDate
fix-tag.description: This tag is currently not used.

fix-tag.name: SendingTime
fix-tag.description: Time of message transmission. Always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fix-tag.name: Shares
fix-tag.description: Number of shares.

fix-tag.name: Symbol
fix-tag.description: Ticker Symbol

fix-tag.name: TargetCompID
fix-tag.description: Assigned value used to identify receiving firm.

fix-tag.name: TargetSubID
fix-tag.description:
Assigned value used to identify specific individual or unit

intended to receive message. "ADMIN" reserved for

administrative messages not intended for a specific user.

fix-tag.name: Text
fix-tag.description: Free format text string

fix-tag.name: TimeInForce
fix-tag.description: Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY.

fix-tag.name: TransactTime
fix-tag.description: Time of execution/order creation expressed in GMT

fix-tag.name: Urgency
fix-tag.description: Urgency Flag

fix-tag.name: ValidUntilTime
fix-tag.description: Indicates expiration time of indication message (always expressed in GMT).

fix-tag.name: SettlmntTyp
fix-tag.description:
Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is

interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default

settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fix-tag.name: FutSettDate
fix-tag.description:
Specific date of trade settlement (SettlementDate) in

YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future)

or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fix-tag.name: SymbolSfx
fix-tag.description: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Note also see SecurityType.

fix-tag.name: ListID
fix-tag.description:
Unique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to

associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be

guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate

multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the

ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fix-tag.name: ListSeqNo
fix-tag.description: Sequence of individual order within list (i.e. ListSeqNo of ListNoOrds, 2 of 25, 3 of 25, . . . )

fix-tag.name: ListNoOrds
fix-tag.description:
Total number of list order entries across all messages. Should

be the sum of all NoOrders in each message that has repeating

list order entries related to the same ListID. Used to support fragmentation.

fix-tag.name: ListExecInst
fix-tag.description: Free format text message containing list handling and execution instructions.

fix-tag.name: AllocID
fix-tag.description: Unique identifier for allocation message.

fix-tag.name: AllocTransTyp
fix-tag.description: Identifies allocation transaction type

fix-tag.name: RefAllocID
fix-tag.description: Reference identifier to be used with Replace and Cancel AllocTransType messages.

fix-tag.name: NoOrders
fix-tag.description: Indicates number of orders to be combined for average pricing and allocation.

fix-tag.name: AvgPrxPrecision
fix-tag.description:
Indicates number of decimal places to be used for average pricing.

Absence of this field indicates that default precision

arranged by the broker/institution is to be used.

fix-tag.name: TradeDate
fix-tag.description:
Indicates date of trade referenced in this message in YYYYMMDD format.

Absence of this field indicates current

day (expressed in local time at place of trade).

fix-tag.name: ExecBroker
fix-tag.description: Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fix-tag.name: OpenClose
fix-tag.description: For options only.

fix-tag.name: NoAllocs
fix-tag.description: Number of repeating AllocAccount/AllocPrice entries.

fix-tag.name: AllocAccount
fix-tag.description: Sub-account mnemonic.

fix-tag.name: AllocShares
fix-tag.description: Number of shares to be allocated to specific sub-account

fix-tag.name: ProcessCode
fix-tag.description:
Processing code for sub-account. Absence of this field in

AllocAccount / AllocPrice/AllocShares / ProcessCode instance

indicates regular trade.

fix-tag.name: NoRpts
fix-tag.description: Total number of reports within series.

fix-tag.name: RptSeq
fix-tag.description: Sequence number of message within report series.

fix-tag.name: CxlQty
fix-tag.description: Total number of shares canceled for this order.

fix-tag.name: NoDlvyInst
fix-tag.description: Number of delivery instruction fields to follow.

fix-tag.name: DlvyInst
fix-tag.description: Free format text field to indicate delivery instructions

fix-tag.name: AllocStatus
fix-tag.description: Identifies status of allocation.

fix-tag.name: AllocRejCode
fix-tag.description: Identifies reason for rejection.

fix-tag.name: Signature
fix-tag.description: Electronic signature

fix-tag.name: SecureDataLen
fix-tag.description: Length of encrypted message

fix-tag.name: SecureData
fix-tag.description: Actual encrypted data stream

fix-tag.name: BrokerOfCredit
fix-tag.description: Broker to receive trade credit.

fix-tag.name: SignatureLength
fix-tag.description: Number of bytes in signature field.

fix-tag.name: EmailType
fix-tag.description: Email message type.

fix-tag.name: RawDataLength
fix-tag.description: Number of bytes in raw data field.

fix-tag.name: RawData
fix-tag.description: Unformatted raw data, can include bitmaps, word processor documents, etc.

fix-tag.name: PossResend
fix-tag.description: Indicates that message may contain information that has been sent under another sequence number.

fix-tag.name: EncryptMethod
fix-tag.description: Method of encryption.

valid-value.name: PGP/DES-MD5
valid-value.description: PGP/DES-MD5 (see app note on FIX web site)

valid-value.name: PEM/DES-MD5
valid-value.description: PEM/DES-MD5 (see app note on FIX web site)

fix-tag.name: StopPx
fix-tag.description: Price per share

fix-tag.name: ExDestination
fix-tag.description: Execution destination as defined by institution when order is entered.

fix-tag.name: CxlRejReason
fix-tag.description: Code to identify reason for cancel rejection.

fix-tag.name: OrdRejReason
fix-tag.description: Code to identify reason for order rejection.

fix-tag.name: IOIQualifier
fix-tag.description: Code to qualify IOI use.

fix-tag.name: WaveNo
fix-tag.description: Identifier to aid in the management of multiple lists derived from a single, master list.

fix-tag.name: Issuer
fix-tag.description: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fix-tag.name: SecurityDesc
fix-tag.description: Security description.

fix-tag.name: HeartBtInt
fix-tag.description: Heartbeat interval (seconds)

fix-tag.name: ClientID
fix-tag.description: Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fix-tag.name: MinQty
fix-tag.description: Minimum quantity of an order to be executed.

fix-tag.name: MaxFloor
fix-tag.description: Maximum number of shares within an order to be shown on the exchange floor at any given time.

fix-tag.name: TestReqID
fix-tag.description: Identifier included in Test Request message to be returned in resulting Heartbeat

fix-tag.name: ReportToExch
fix-tag.description: Identifies party of trade responsible for exchange reporting.

valid-value.name: Receiver Reports
valid-value.description: Indicates that party receiving message must report trade

valid-value.name: Sender Reports
valid-value.description: Indicates that party sending message will report trade

fix-tag.name: LocateReqd
fix-tag.description: Indicates whether the broker is to locate the stock in conjunction with a short sell order.

valid-value.name: Broker Locate required
valid-value.description: Indicates the broker is responsible for locating the stock

valid-value.name: Broker Locate not required
valid-value.description: Indicates the broker is not required to locate

fix-tag.name: OnBehalfOfCompID
fix-tag.description:
Assigned value used to identify firm originating message if the

message was delivered by a third party i.e. the third party firm

identifier would be delivered in the SenderCompID field and the

firm originating the message in this field.

fix-tag.name: OnBehalfOfSubID
fix-tag.description: Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (i.e. trader) if the message was delivered by a third party

fix-tag.name: QuoteID
fix-tag.description: Unique identifier for quote

fix-tag.name: NetMoney
fix-tag.description:
Total amount due as the result of the transaction

(e.g. for Buy order - principal + commission + fees)

reported in currency of execution.

fix-tag.name: SettlCurrAmt
fix-tag.description: Total amount due expressed in settlement currency (includes the effect of the forex transaction)

fix-tag.name: SettlCurrency
fix-tag.description: Currency code of settlement denomination.

fix-tag.name: ForexReq
fix-tag.description: Indicates request for forex accommodation trade to be executed along with security transaction.

valid-value.name: Don't execute Forex
valid-value.description: Do not execute Forex after security trade

fix-tag.name: OrigSendingTime
fix-tag.description: Original time of message transmission (always expressed in GMT when transmitting orders as the result of a resend request.

fix-tag.name: NoExecs
fix-tag.description: No of execution repeating group entries to follow.

fix-tag.name: CxlType
fix-tag.description: Defines if cancel is for part or all of the remaining quantity of an order.

fix-tag.name: ExpireTime
fix-tag.description: Time/Date of order expiration expressed in GMT

fix-tag.name: DKReason
fix-tag.description: Reason for execution rejection.

fix-tag.name: DeliverToCompID
fix-tag.description:
Assigned value used to identify the firm targeted to receive the

message if the message is delivered by a third party i.e. the

third party firm identifier would be delivered in the

TargetCompID field and the ultimate receiver firm ID in this field.

fix-tag.name: DeliverToSubID
fix-tag.description: Assigned value used to identify specific message recipient (i.e. trader) if the message is delivered by a third part

fix-tag.name: IOINaturalFlag
fix-tag.description:
Indicates that IOI is the result of an existing agency order or a

facilitation position resulting from an agency order, not from

principal trading or order solicitation activity.

fix-tag.name: QuoteReqID
fix-tag.description: Unique identifier for quote request

fix-tag.name: BidPx
fix-tag.description: Bid price/rate

fix-tag.name: OfferPx
fix-tag.description: Offer price/rate

fix-tag.name: BidSize
fix-tag.description: Quantity of bid

fix-tag.name: OfferSize
fix-tag.description: Quantity of offer

fix-tag.name: NoMiscFees
fix-tag.description: Number of repeating groups of miscellaneous fees

fix-tag.name: MiscFeeAmt
fix-tag.description: Miscellaneous fee value

fix-tag.name: MiscFeeCurr
fix-tag.description: Currency of miscellaneous fee

fix-tag.name: MiscFeeType
fix-tag.description: Indicates type of miscellaneous fee.

fix-tag.name: PrevClosePx
fix-tag.description: Previous closing price of security.
